pages.description: Cover sheet for a new ADU above existing garage at 326 Flint Ave., Long Beach CA. Contains scope of work, general notes, sheet index, designer's statement, legal description, owner information, and approval stamp from Anthony Montes - Building Plan Check.
key_content: Project: New ADU above existing garage (2nd floor loft/suite)
ADU address: 326 Flint Ave., Unit 'A', Long Beach CA 90814
Main home address: 326 Flint Ave.
Scope: Open studio layout with kitchen, laundry closet with stacked W/D, new exercise area at top stairway (10 sqft), new covered patio (856 sqft)
New cabinet heat pump water heater placed within a framed/closed cabinet
New electric ductless heat pump mini-split condenser
New 100 AMP electrical meter for ADU
Governing codes: 2022 CBC, 2022 CRC, 2022 CMC, 2022 CPC, 2022 CEC, 2022 T24, Long Beach Municipal Code Title 19
Proposed ADU will have gas hook up for range & dryer
Pre-Construction Inspection Meeting Required
APPROVED by Anthony Montes - Building Plan Check
NOT SHOWN: ADU livable square footage (only patio area of 856 sqft mentioned in scope)
NOT SHOWN: existing home square footage
NOT SHOWN: lot size
NOT SHOWN: bedroom/bathroom count
NOT SHOWN: designer license number
NOT SHOWN: structural engineer identification
NOT SHOWN: energy consultant identification

pages.sheet_title: City of Long Beach Forms and Notes — Best Management Practices
pages.description: Compilation of City of Long Beach information bulletins: BU-038 Erosion Control Best Management Practices, BU-038 Construction Activity Best Management Practices, and IS-056 Residential Bathroom Remodel reference. Contains erosion control BMPs, hazardous waste management, spill prevention, solid waste management, vehicle/equipment cleaning, and paving operations guidelines.
key_content: City of Long Beach Information Bulletin BU-038: Erosion Control Best Management Practices (effective 04-01-2011, revised 06-30-2017)
BMP categories: Scheduling, Preservation of Existing Vegetation, Material Delivery and Storage, Hazardous Waste Management
ESCO categories: Scheduling, Silt Fence, Sand Bag Barrier, Sediment Basin, Stabilized Construction Entrance
CASE categories: Spill Prevention and Control, Solid Waste Management, Hazardous Waste Management, Paving and Grinding Operations, Vehicle and Equipment Cleaning/Fueling/Maintenance
City of Long Beach Information Bulletin IS-056: Residential Bathroom Remodel (reference handout)
APPROVED by Anthony Montes - Building Plan Check

pages.sheet_title: 2022 CalGreen AIA Checklist — Residential Mandatory Measures, Sheet 1
pages.description: 2022 California Green Building Standards Code residential mandatory measures checklist (July 2024 Supplement). Covers Chapter 3 (General scope), Chapter 4 Divisions 4.1 through 4.5: Planning and Design (storm water, EV charging), Energy Efficiency, Water Efficiency and Conservation (fixture flow rates, MWELO), Material Conservation and Resource Efficiency (construction waste, moisture), and Environmental Quality (VOC limits, indoor air quality, pollutant control).
key_content: 2022 CalGreen Residential Mandatory Measures (July 2024 Supplement)
Section 4.106.4: EV charging requirements for new construction — EVCS provisions, Level 2 EV charging, NEMA 14-50 receptacle
Section 4.106.2: Storm water pollution prevention — onsite retention of 85th percentile 24-hour storm event for projects adding/replacing more than 2,500 sqft impervious surface
Section 4.303.1: Kitchen faucets max 1.8 GPM at 60 PSI
Section 4.304.1: Outdoor potable water use references MWELO
Section 4.405.1: Construction waste reduction, disposal, and recycling provisions
Section 4.504.2: Adhesives, sealants, and caulks VOC limits per SCAQMD rules
Section 4.504.3: Paints and coatings — flat coatings 50 g/L VOC, non-flat coatings 100 g/L VOC, SCAQMD Rule 1113
Section 4.505: Bathroom exhaust fans ENERGY STAR rated required
Section 4.506: HVAC minimum filtration requirements (MERV rating)
APPROVED by Anthony Montes - Building Plan Check
NOT SHOWN: checkbox completion status (individual checkboxes not legible at extraction resolution)
NOT SHOWN: specific lavatory faucet flow rate values (table text too small)
NOT SHOWN: specific formaldehyde ppm limits (text too small)
NOT SHOWN: construction waste diversion percentage (specific % not legible)

drawing_zones.content: Chapter 3: Green Building scope, Section 301-303 general provisions
Chapter 4: Residential Mandatory Measures, Division 4.1 Planning and Design, Section 4.106 Site Development, EV Charging (4.106.4)
Section 4.106.4.2.1 EV charging for one-family/two-family dwellings
Division 4.2 Energy Efficiency, Division 4.3 Water Efficiency and Conservation (fixture flow rates)
Division 4.4 Material Conservation and Resource Efficiency, Division 4.5 Environmental Quality (VOC, IAQ, pollutant control, fireplaces)
APPROVED stamp — Anthony Montes - Building Plan Check
Title block: Sheet A1A.1, Ideal Designs, 2022 CalGreen AIA Checklist

Indoor air quality: exhaust fans ENERGY STAR rated, ducted to exterior

pages.description: Second floor ADU plan with window schedule, door schedule, egress standards, plumbing fixture notes, smoke/CO alarm requirements, electrical symbols legend, glazing notes, and construction notes. Includes two renderings of the floor plan (architectural and electrical layout).
key_content: ADU floor plan: 2nd floor above existing garage, 17' wide
Layout: 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom, open living/kitchen area (inferred from plan)
Window schedule: A=3'0"x4'0", B=3'4"x5'0", C=6'0"x4' — all tempered glass/vinyl
Min. bedroom egress: 20" min width, 24" min height, 5.0 sq ft net clear (upper floor), 44" max sill height
Door schedule: A=3'-0"x6'-8" (front door w/ security lock), B=2'-6"x6'-8", C=2'-4"x6'-8" — wood
Plumbing fixture flow rates: lavatory 1.2 GPM, kitchen 1.8 GPM, showerhead 1.8 GPM at 80 PSI, toilet 1.28 GPF (HET)
Smoke alarms: in each sleeping room, outside sleeping areas, each story — interconnected hard-wired
CO alarms: outside sleeping areas, each bedroom, every level — interconnected hard-wired with battery backup
Exhaust fan: Energy Star-rated, ceiling-mounted
IAQ continuous exhaust: 100 CFM
Dryer exhaust duct: max 14 ft with 2 elbows per CMC 504
Safety glazing required within 24" of doors and in shower/tub enclosures
Attic access: min 22"x30" opening required where attic area exceeds 30 sq ft
Drainage: graded to drain surface water away from building per Section 1804.3
Electrical panel: 60 amp sub-panel within ADU
APPROVED stamp signed by Anthony Montez — Building Plan Check
NOT SHOWN: window U-factor and SHGC values (schedule says contractor to verify)
NOT SHOWN: fire-rated wall callouts (1-HR assembly details)
NOT SHOWN: wall framing spec (stud size, spacing, GWB type/thickness)

NOT SHOWN: ceiling height
NOT SHOWN: kitchen ventilation / range hood CFM
NOT SHOWN: electrical panel location on plan

pages.description: Four exterior elevations (West, North, East, South) of the new ADU above existing garage, a proposed roof plan, attic and ceiling/floor ventilation calculations, roofing material specs, roof/elevation legends, and a metal guardrailing detail.
key_content: West Elevation: 2-story structure, (E) Garage below, 17' new ADU above, mini-split condenser on roof
North Elevation: 20' existing garage width, 29'-3" new ADU above garage, 3:12 roof pitch, stucco exterior
East Elevation: (E) Garage with condenser mounted atop, vinyl screening
South Elevation: (N) electric heat pump water heater within framed enclosed enclosure, 11'-4" dimension
Attic ventilation calc: 475.0 SF attic, requires 3.17 SF net free ventilation, 4 dormer vents 24"x12" (400 SI), 2 gable vents (140 SI), total 540 SI net free
Ceiling/floor ventilation calc: 3,360 SF area, 9 floor vents 14"x4" (416 SI total), methane ventilation required
Roofing: 30-year comp fiberglass, GAF Class A shingles CCR COR-1410, 4.17 PSF
Exterior lath: two layers Grade D paper 60 min
Roof plan shows mini-split multi-zone system, dormer vents, gable vents, purlins layout
Metal guardrailing detail: 4" max sphere opening, A35 clip at deck, 2x4 perm plate
4-end ceiling vents in garage for methane gas ventilation
APPROVED by Anthony Montes - Building Plan Check, 10/05/23
NOT SHOWN: exact building height dimension (grade to peak) — shown but not clearly legible
NOT SHOWN: solar panel array location (required for new detached ADU)
NOT SHOWN: wall assembly R-values

pages.description: Structural notes sheet containing the 2022 CBC Table 2304.10.2 nailing/fastening schedule, concrete specifications, foundation requirements, seismic design criteria, structural wood specifications, rebar requirements, and comprehensive general structural notes. Prepared by structural engineer Jose Ramirez, PE.
key_content: 2022 CBC Table 2304.10.2 Fastening Schedule (full nailing schedule, ~40+ connections)
Nailing: sole plate to joist 16d @ 16" o.c., top plate to stud 2-16d end nail, stud to sole plate 4-8d or 3-16d toenail
Nailing: double top plates 16d @ 16" o.c., ceiling joists to plate 3-8d toenail, rafter to plate 3-8d toenail
Nailing: wall sheathing 6d (up to 1/2"), 8d (over 1/2"), roof sheathing 8d (up to 3/4")
Concrete specifications section present
Foundation specifications section present
Design criteria section with seismic design parameters (Ss, S1, SDS, SD1, Seismic Design Category)
Structural wood: DFL #2 or better, pressure-treated sill plates
Rebar: ASTM A615 Grade 60, cover and lap splice requirements
General structural notes with code references, inspection requirements, special inspections
Hardware: Simpson or equivalent
Structural engineer: Jose Ramirez, PE — Project No. 61-097
APPROVED by Anthony Montes - Building Plan Check

pages.description: Foundation plan for new ADU above existing garage showing column locations (HSS 4x4x1/4), holdowns, shearwall marks, existing footing to be field verified, pad footing schedule, shearwall schedule, concrete grade beam schedule (GB1), and plan notes. Scale 1/4" = 1'-0".
key_content: Foundation plan at 1/4" = 1'-0" scale
HSS 4x4x1/4 steel columns at multiple locations
Existing 1'-0" wide continuous footing to be field verified
Existing 2x4 wall stud to be field verified
HDU2 holdowns at shearwall locations
4x4 wood posts at column bases
1.75x14 LVL stringers @ 12" O.C.
Shearwall schedule: STRUC 1 (15d nail, 6"/12" edge/field, 312 PLF)
Pad footing schedule: 6 types ranging from 2'-0"x2'-0" to 4'-0"x2'-6", capacities 3.84 to 21.60 KIPS
Pad footing min. bearing depth: 18" interior, 24" exterior
Allowable bearing pressure: 1,500 PSF
Concrete grade beam GB1: 12" wide x 24" deep, 3-#4 T&B, #3 stirrups @ 12" min.
Concrete min f'c: 3,000 PSI
TYP continuous footing: 12" wide x 24" min. bearing depth, 3-#4 T&B, into competent soil
Anchor bolts embedded 7" min. into concrete, spaced max 6' O.C. with plate washer
All structural walls 2x4 studs @ 16" O.C. unless noted otherwise
Foundation sills: naturally durable or preservative-treated wood, HDG or stainless fasteners
Use 3x side nailer per detail 10/S3.3 and edge nail shear wall to column in lieu of holdown
Use 16 side nailer per detail 10/S3.3, #14 x 1" screws at 16" O.C. staggered
Full height foundation to roof columns
12 plan notes referencing S1.0 structural notes and S3.0-S3.1 details
APPROVED by Anthony Montez - Building Plan Check
NOT SHOWN: vapor barrier notation
NOT SHOWN: epoxy dowel specs (connecting to existing foundation)

pages.description: Structural typical details sheet with 8 detail drawings covering partition wall anchorage, slab-on-grade, stepping footing, reinforcement ties/stirrups, footing at pipe/conduit, footing intersections, plate splice fix, and sill bolt/hooks details.
key_content: Detail 3: Partition top connection — Simpson STC @ 48" O.C. (parallel to joist), Simpson HTC @ 48" O.C. (perpendicular)
Detail 3: Shot pins — Hilti S 1/4" dia. x 2" long power-driven pins @ 32" O.C., 1/2" min concrete penetration
Detail 3: Anchor bolt at curb — 1/2" dia. headed anchor x 8" @ 48" O.C. max
Detail 1: Slab on grade — weakened plane joint (sawcut), vapor barrier, clean gravel, 12" min step height
Detail 7: Stepping continuous footing — reinforcement same size and spacing as footing reinforcement, top bars where occurs
Detail 5: Reinforcement — tie splice alternation, column ties (ductile and optional), beam stirrups, bend 4 db minimum
Detail 12: Footing at pipe/conduit — 90% compaction, sleeve I.D. 2" min larger than pipe O.D., no pipes within restricted height zone
Detail 11: Footing intersections — 2 #5 cont., 2 #5 vertical U.O.N., outside corner lap bars, std 90-degree hook at inside bars
Detail 10: Plate splice fix — 6-16d each side of splice, required when gap > 8"
Detail 9: Sill bolt detail — 2x filler pieces to bridge bolt head, studs @ 16" O.C.
NOT SHOWN: shearwall schedule (likely on separate detail sheet)
NOT SHOWN: holdown schedule (likely on separate detail sheet)

pages.description: Structural typical details sheet with 12 numbered detail zones covering opening at roof/floor, roof/floor diaphragm assembly, top plate splice table, boring and notching rules, beam-to-post connections, beam-to-beam hanger connections, beam perpendicular to wall, ceiling joist details, and header schedule with trimmer stud table.
key_content: Top plate splice schedule: 2x4 with 2-6 nails = 1250# to 2090#, 2x6 with 2-6 to 2-16 nails = 2500# to 3740#
Header schedule: bearing walls up to 3'=4x4, 4'=4x6, 5'=4x8, 6'=4x10, 7'=4x12
Header schedule: non-bearing walls up to 4'=4x4, 6'=4x6, 8'=4x8, 10'=4x10
Trimmer stud table: opening 0'-4' = 1 trimmer all walls, 6'-8' = 2 trimmers exterior / 1 interior, 8'-10' = 2 all / 2 interior
Boring and notching: notching not allowed in middle 1/3 of span, max bore D/3, max notch 2/3 at bearing
Roof/floor diaphragm: 4'x8' sheathing panels, 1/8" min panel gap, edge nailing at diaphragm edges
Beam to post: ACE/AC post caps each side, Simpson A34/A35 clips
Beam to beam hanger: Simpson GLT hanger (GLB), GLTY hanger (PSL), HGU HDR, HU hanger
Ceiling joist detail: 16d @ 8" O.C. at each ceiling joist, A34 tie @ 32" O.C. max
6x lintel members required in 2x6 stud walls
HDR 2-16d for each 3" in header depth
Simpson U hanger at roof/floor openings for TJI's, 4x10 HDR with Simpson W hanger

drawing_zones.content: Opening at roof/floor — joist header detail with Simpson hangers
Roof/floor diaphragm assembly — sheathing, edge nailing, field nailing
Top plate splice table with design loads
Boring and notching rules for joists/rafters and studs
4x or 6x beam to post connection with post caps
Beam to beam hanger connections — PSL/GLB and 4x/6x
Beam perpendicular to wall — beam on top plates and flush with top plates
Ceiling joist detail with and without ledger
Header detail with header schedule and trimmer stud count table
Title block — Ramirez Structural Inc, S3.2

pages.description: Structural typical details sheet covering partition bottom connection to floor, ledger splice, engineered beam to post with CC/ECC post caps, four strap holdown configurations (to header, drope beam, flush beam, typical), nailer-on-beam connections for shearwall and non-shearwall conditions, and post over wood beam detail.
key_content: Strap holdown details: 4 configurations (A=typical, B=to flush beam, C=to drope beam, D=to header)
Strap holdown: HD strap & nailing per schedule, holdown post 4x min, block align or stud post
Strap holdown note: if end length L > header/beam depth, strap around bottom and nail accordingly
Engineered beam to post: CC6 and ECC6 column caps may be used in lieu of CC and ECC respectively
Nailer on beam shearwall: 3/4 DIA threaded stud bolts @ 24" O.C. at shearwalls
Nailer on beam non-shearwall: 3/4 DIA threaded stud bolts @ 8" O.C. (3 min.)
Nailer connection: 4x cont. nailer width to match flange, 1/2 stud bolts @ 36" stagger
Partition bot. conn.: 2x4 studs @ 16" U.O.N., 2x4 plate w/2-16d nails @ 16" to jst/blk
Ledger splice: MS760 strap at splice
Post over wood beam: Simpson BC post cap
Provide 8" from end of wood nailer to CL. of bolt/stud typical

drawing_zones.content: Partition bottom connection to floor — joist perpendicular and parallel
Ledger splice with MS760 strap — single and double strap options
Engineered beam to post with CC/ECC post caps — elevation and perspective views
Strap holdowns — 4 sub-details: D=to header, C=to drope beam, B=to flush beam, A=typical
Nailer connection with threaded studs/machine bolts — alternate 1 and 2
Typical nailer on beam — shearwall and non-shearwall conditions
Post over wood beam with Simpson BC post cap

pages.description: Structural typical details sheet covering steel column base plate connections (3 plan configurations A/B/C), fillet weld schedule, optional Hilti Kwik Bolts TZ expansion anchor specification, steel beam end connection with stiffener plates, and column base plate cap detail. Lower half of sheet is blank/unused.
key_content: Base plate Plan A: 1/2" thick on 1-1/2" min non-shrink grout bed, 4-1/2" DIA A.B.'s with DBL nuts
Base plate Plan B: 1/2" x steel column + 1/4", 1/2" min non-shrink grout, 2-1/2" DIA A.B.'s with DBL nuts, 18" long A.B.'s at conc. curbs and shear panels
Base plate Plan C: at wall corners, same as Plan B for items not noted
Fillet weld schedule: to 3/4" = 1/8, over 3/4" to 1/2" = 3/16, over 1/2" to 3/4" = 1/4, over 3/4" = 5/16
Optional: 3/4" DIA Hilti Kwik Bolts TZ expansion anchors, 5" embedment (ESR-1917, LARR #25701) with special inspection
Steel beam end: stiffener PL 3/8" each side, cap PL flange THK 8" min x BM flange width w/ 4-3/4" DIA M.B.'s
Column base plate: cap PL 3/4", PL 3/4" x 3" wide EA side w/ 2-3/4" DIA M.B.'s
Beam seat: L 3-1/2 x 3 x 5 x (D+3)"
Non-shrink grout required at all base plates

drawing_zones.content: Steel column base plate — cap plate and side plates with machine bolts
Base plate plans A, B, C with anchor bolt configurations, fillet weld schedule, and optional Hilti expansion anchor note

pages.description: Structural foundation detail sheet with 12 numbered details covering footing connections, column base plates, epoxy dowel anchoring to existing concrete, holdown post connections, shearwall sill plate anchoring, and post pedestal details. Multiple details reference Simpson SET-3G epoxy with special inspection requirements.
key_content: Epoxy anchor spec: Simpson SET-3G (ICC-ES/AC 308 and ESR 4057), 6" min. embedment, special inspection required
Detail 9: Sill plate anchor — 3/4" dia. Simpson retrofit bolts @ 32" O.C. max, SET-3G epoxy (ICC-ES AC517), 6" embedment, special inspection required
Detail 10: Holdown post to footing — threaded rod drill & epoxy, 15" embed for 5/8" dia. A.B.S., special inspection required
Detail 8: New to existing footing connection — dowels to match footing, 2'-0" min. lap, drill & epoxy SET-3G
Detail 2: Pad footing — 1-1/4" x 14" LVL stringer, 2x4 P.T. D.F. P.L. & A.B. @ 24" O.C.
Detail 4: Strongwall connection at new/existing foundation — threaded rod A.B., reinf. to match cont. ftg. min. lap 2'-0"
Detail 11: CB post base — #3 ties @ 8" max., 4-#4 vert. w/ std. hooks
Detail 7: Column to footing with #6 dowels T & B, base plate per detail 2/S3.4
Special inspection required for all epoxy dowel connections

NOT SHOWN: holdown schedule (referenced but on separate sheet)
